name: Holiday Inn Old Sydney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We liked being in the heart of the action in Sydney down in the rocks.
reviews.title: Nice location and lovely decor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is everything you want, not cheap, but all is faultless.
reviews.title: Tired decor, but excellent location, good service, great views.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Wonderful stay for our family
reviews.title: It met my expectations and I loved it! I'd go back here in a heartbeat.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, I got a good deal through Expedia to stay at this hotel. I would not pay the going rate, as I think that this hotel is overpriced for what it is. The location, in the heart of The Rocks in Sydney, is absolutely perfect. You are only a short stroll to the harbour or any number of attractions, eateries and transport.
reviews.title: Too much outside noise for sleeping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The check in was smooth, although I has to make a phone call to the hotel from my car to ascertain the arrangements for parking. The hotel is valet only, and they only have 3 spots for pre-valet parking. I was given a room on the 4th floor, with a view of the Opera House and Circular Quay. The view was only partially obstructed by a heritage building accross the road, but that is to be expected on the 4th floor.
reviews.title: Rip Off!! Hotel Phone Charges

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here for five nights. The location of this hotel is excellent. Circular quay is a couple of minutes walk away in one direction and the harbour bridge is about five minutes away in the other. Our room had an excellent view of the quay and we found the reception staff to be very helpful. The accommodation itself is not 'four star'. The rooms are small and the furniture needs replacing or an overhaul. The bathroooms are exceptionally cramped, shabby and dirty. Room service was slow - we requested some toilet paper one evening which took two phone calls and a thirty minute wait! The reception area terraces are dimly lit and dull making the whole place resemble an old prison. I would not stay in this hotel again as I don't think the accommodation merits the price. Also when we checked out our bill was incorrect.
reviews.title: Great location, tired hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked here on a recommendation of a work collegue - so glad we did - the location and hotel were wonderful. A large group of us "poms" had gone out to Oz & we were the only couple to have booked in here - and were the envy of all our friends.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were helpful & friendly. The rooms were clean & kept @ the right temperature. The breakfast was good - though a little pricy - if you can venture out to a near by diner on circular quay - I would.
reviews.title: Clean room, poor service
BEST Location in Sydney--And A Fine Property
reviews.text: I could rave on about the view from the roof pool - certainly has the "wow" factor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location could not be bettered. The weekend market is literally outside the front door - and the open top tour bus stop is located directly opposite the hotel - perfect.
reviews.title: Good on the outside, not so good on the inside

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed in the Holiday Inn Old Sydney for one night in December 2010 while in Sydney on Business.
reviews.title: Perfect location - sound 4 star hotel, a bit dated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a comfortable but dated hotel, in a perfect location at The Rocks, with an amazing view from the rooftop swimming pool of both the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge.
reviews.title: Superb hotel, fabulous location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Staying in an Executive King room, the room was clean and well presented. Check in and check out was efficient, valet parking is available although staff do not offer to help you with your luggage to your room.
reviews.title: Great Location and Good Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were friendly and efficient. A bar and breakfast room are at the property, however there is no restaurant on-site for dinner. Room service is however available. The room featured a fridge but did not feature a stocked mini-bar, rather a price list and ability to get room service to send up items. This was a bit inconvenient as it would be much easier and customary to be able to get a drink from the mini bar without needing to call room service.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately this hotel has introduced credit card surcharges of 1.5%. I find it poor that while hotels enjoy more benefits of credit card use than most other industries (booking guarantees, pre-authorisations, charging for no-shows, charging for late charges, avoiding large cash transactions), the industry has been one of the most bullish industries in Australia to introduce credit card surcharges, and that most major groups have magically chosen exactly the same percentage to surcharge. This surcharge will encourages me to look elsewhere next time I travel rather than simply rebooking at this hotel.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Great View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from Sydney. We spent our last night at the Holiday Inn Old Sydney. When we checked in we were offered an upgrade which we took. The room was spacious and well appointed. As we were on a late flight out Monday we asked for a late check out this was granted happily. The service friendly and obliging staff stood out for us. We would recommend this hotel, and would stay there again.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: The absolute beauty of this hotel is its location in the rocks. The surrounding area and the stunning views from the roof are fabulous. However, in my opinion, this is a good 3 star hotel and nothing more. Some of the common areas are poor - particularly the landings to the rooms and the service was just ok for my stay. Did not really impact on my enjoyment but given the hotel price I would shop around for something else unless you can get a really good deal
reviews.title: Great Location...ok hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed here with my family (8 and 12 yo) for four nights. We were in Sydney for a wedding and we have stayed at this hotel previously. I was perplexed by some of the reviews the hotel is getting, but as we have stayed here previously and the location is second to none we were really happy to book again.
reviews.title: Great stay..location is fantastic.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011
reviews.text: I tried to book through the hotel website but could not confirm a family room for the fourth night. I rang the hotel directly and they upgraded someone else which gave us access to the family room for the fourth night. I was really happy with this service and I am sure the other guests appreciated the upgrade.
reviews.title: Great location, mediocre hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was ready when we arrived and check in was easy and quick. The hotel itself is within the heritage area of the rocks so they are very restricted in regard to upgrades that they can do. The pool area is small and it isn't very deep, the view is fantastic.
reviews.title: Fantastic location for sightseeing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night at the Holiday Inn Old Sydney. We chose this hotel as it is just across the road from the Overseas Passenger Terminal and we had an appointment on a cruise ship the next morning. It is a good hotel with standard features but not a resort hotel by any means. The best feature is its location in the Rocks and proximity to the passenger terminal. The is a great view from the roof top. We also enjoyed the happy of half price local beers between 5:00 and 6:00.
reviews.title: Not a resort hotel but a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed in many Holiday Inns in the UK we were a bit disappointed with the quality of this one. It's definitely looking tired. Our room was tiny as was the bathroom. The view of the harbour from the roof is fantastic but the pool is again...'tiny'. There's no gym but guests have free access to Fitness First which is a 10 minute walk away. The saving grace for this hotel is it's fantastic location. It's in the heart of The Rocks - you have the Opera House and Harbour Bridge within walking distance and lots of great bars and restaurants. On Sundays market stalls line the streets outside the hotel.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Excellent location. As the name suggests “OLD’ it was. Our room was very tired and the bathroom certainly required an update.. Very over priced. We were very disappointed with the service we received re our parking.
reviews.title: Look elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We booked the accommodation in Feb last year and requested parking for the 7th as well as the 8th Jan for one car and just the 8th for a second car, as it was our daughters wedding.
reviews.title: Location cannot get any better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I confirmed the booking that week and it was mentioned that parking was noted for the 7th Jan.
reviews.title: Perfect location to explore Sydney
A good budget option
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here as the main part of our honeymoon stay in Sydney, due to its central location and its affordability. On arrival we were allocated our opera view room which was on the 6th floor, with a great view of the opera house. Could not have been a more central view, although it was often obstructed by cruise ships which docked in front of the window and blocked the opera view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel itself is pretty basic in terms of the rooms, but there is everything you need for a functional stay. I had to complain while I was there as the room was not as clean as it could have been. We had stayed there for 5 nights and the bathroom floor had not been cleaned once, nor had our carpet been vacuumed. This is not what I would expect, but once I had complained twice, this was rectified.
reviews.title: Getting it right.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was good, although pretty badly organised, with tables being allocated very slowly and everyone feeling a bit crowded. But the food was very good and varied. Most of the people who stayed at the hotel were older British couples who seemed to be there as part of a package.
reviews.title: A lovely surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The roof top pool is nowhere near as big as it looks on pictures but is still stunning with great views and is a lovely place to relax and get away from it all.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in the heart of Sydney
Good service, great location
reviews.text: Overall, would return again without hesitation.

reviews.title: good location
reviews.text: booked here for our last night in oz having wandered past and seen its great location, and even better paid using the priority points so it was free - overall a great location and ok hotel - -

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we had room on 4th floor with a view sort of of the bay, which was a plesant suprise,
reviews.title: Needs work

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: room was good size, and seemed pretty clean, however bathroom was grubby, needed tarting up - and even had old towel on back of door from previous guest!!
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Woke up suffocating at 2am as room had got so hot and stuffy despite turning antiquated air con as cold as possible and then opening window - couldnt bear it any longer so called reception who advised me you had to flick a random switch to activate the aor con!! - shame no one had told us before!
reviews.title: Great Start

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: I would stay here again due to location, and the nice benefit of the rooftop 'pool' (its small dont be fooled by canny photos) -providing I got a good rate, otherwise for a much better service, and cleanliness standard would stay at the darling harbour holiday inn. (if I had to stay in a chain)
reviews.title: Great location but a little tired!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is fantastically positioned in the old Rocks area of Sydney. If you ask for an executive room you will be looking out to The Opera House across the harbour and Sydney Harbour bridge to the left - absolutely fantastic view! The rooms are huge with a living area and well as king size bed, flat screen tv, huge wardrobes, writing desk and mini bar. You are really close to the bars and restaurants in this area - in fact thats probably the best and worst point! It gets really noisy at night when the pubs shut!
reviews.title: Loved the View - not too keen on the noise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a swimming pool on the roof of the hotel which again gives brilliant views across to the Botanical Gardens. We were only here for 2 nights so we didn't lose too much sleep, but I don't know if I would recommend it for too much longer. Apart from the noise this was a great hotel.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Old Sydney Holiday Inn is in a great location, surrounded by lots of nice little cafes, restaurants and pubs. All the sights are only walking distance.
reviews.title: Location, location location etc etc etc

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the hotel where friendly and helpful, everything was clean and well maintained. The rooms where fine, a bit small but overall good.
reviews.title: Great locatiom, but overpriced basic rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is reasonably priced for the location and i would recommend it to everyone.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

aka: Holiday Inn Old Sydney Hotel Sydney
description: Holiday Inn Old Sydney is one of Sydney's little secrets, uniquely positioned between the Harbour Bridge and Sydney Opera House within the iconic area of The Rocks. Each of the modern 175 guestrooms come equipped with a choice of soft & firm pillows, 32-inch flatscreen TVs, high speed internet access and comfortable en-suite with dual pressure showerhead. Enjoy spectacular views to Sydney Harbour or an outlook onto the historic Rocks from the comfort of your room. Stroll down the harbour-side promenade past the museum of Contemporary Art to lively Circular Quay and experience an excellent selection restaurants and bars. Here you can catch a ferry to Manly Beach, Watsons Bay, Taronga Zoo or enjoy a fabulous harbour cruise. Holiday Inn Old Sydney is only moments from the majority of Sydney's best attractions and a variety of great shopping options, including the Rocks Markets, Queen Victoria Building, Pitt Street Mall and Oxford Street. Experience spectacular views of Sydney Harbour, the famous Harbour Bridge and the world-acclaimed Opera House from the famous Holiday Inn Old Sydney rooftop, equipped with heated outdoor pool and spa. Holiday Inn Old Sydney also offers a complimentary business centre with computer and internet access to keep you connected whilst away from home.
